trans-unit.source: Step 4(a): Configure the Request Bridge
trans-unit.target: Step 4(a): Configure the Request Bridge

trans-unit.source: As part of the request bridge of the <token>request_response</token>, the tutorial demonstrates how to perform the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: As part of the request bridge of the <token>request_response</token>, the tutorial demonstrates how to perform the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Specify the request and response schemas</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, enter the following:
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Specify the request and response schemas</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, enter the following:

trans-unit.source: Request schemas that govern the request messages that the <token>bridge</token> can process.
trans-unit.target: Request schemas that govern the request messages that the <token>bridge</token> can process.

trans-unit.source: Response schemas that govern the structure of the response message that the <token>bridge</token> sends back to the client.
trans-unit.target: Response schemas that govern the structure of the response message that the <token>bridge</token> sends back to the client.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Configure the pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich stage</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, define the properties that must be extracted and promoted within the request message.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Configure the pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich stage</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, define the properties that must be extracted and promoted within the request message.

trans-unit.source: These properties are used within the <token>bridge</token> or within the solution for processing the message, routing it to the destination services, and so on.
trans-unit.target: These properties are used within the <token>bridge</token> or within the solution for processing the message, routing it to the destination services, and so on.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Configure the <token>transform</token> stage</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, include the <token>transform</token>s you defined in the previous steps to <token>transform</token> the ACORD-compliant request messages to messages in a schema compliant with Northwind’s requirements.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Configure the <token>transform</token> stage</embeddedLabel> – In this stage, include the <token>transform</token>s you defined in the previous steps to <token>transform</token> the ACORD-compliant request messages to messages in a schema compliant with Northwind’s requirements.

trans-unit.source: Enter Request and Response Message Schemas
trans-unit.target: Enter Request and Response Message Schemas

trans-unit.source: This section provides instructions on how to add a <token>bridge</token> to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instructions on how to add a <token>bridge</token> to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: The section also describes how to configure the <embeddedLabel>Validate</embeddedLabel> stage to ensure that the <token>bridge</token> processes only those messages that conform to the ACORD request and response schemas.
trans-unit.target: The section also describes how to configure the <embeddedLabel>Validate</embeddedLabel> stage to ensure that the <token>bridge</token> processes only those messages that conform to the ACORD request and response schemas.

trans-unit.source: To add request and response schemas to a <token>bridge</token> configuration
trans-unit.target: To add request and response schemas to a <token>bridge</token> configuration

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Bridges_Services</embeddedLabel> project, double-click the <embeddedLabel>.bcs</embeddedLabel> file to open the itinerary designer.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Bridges_Services</embeddedLabel> project, double-click the <embeddedLabel>.bcs</embeddedLabel> file to open the itinerary designer.

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the itinerary designer and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> and then for the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the itinerary designer and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> and then for the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag-and-drop the <embeddedLabel><token>request_response</token></embeddedLabel> component to the itinerary designer.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag-and-drop the <embeddedLabel><token>request_response</token></embeddedLabel> component to the itinerary designer.

trans-unit.source: As a result a .BridgeConfig file is added to the solution.
trans-unit.target: As a result a .BridgeConfig file is added to the solution.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the <embeddedLabel><token>request_response</token></embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set the <token>bridge</token> entity name to <userInput>XMLBridge</userInput> and the relative address of the <token>bridge</token> to <userInput>ServiceBridge</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the <embeddedLabel><token>request_response</token></embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set the <token>bridge</token> entity name to <userInput>XMLBridge</userInput> and the relative address of the <token>bridge</token> to <userInput>ServiceBridge</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: As a result, the complete endpoint URL where the <token>bridge</token> is deployed is shown in the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Address</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: As a result, the complete endpoint URL where the <token>bridge</token> is deployed is shown in the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Address</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <token>request_response</token> component to open the <token>msgflow</token> design surface.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <token>request_response</token> component to open the <token>msgflow</token> design surface.

trans-unit.source: You can now enter the type of request and response messages that the <token>bridge</token> can process.
trans-unit.target: You can now enter the type of request and response messages that the <token>bridge</token> can process.

trans-unit.source: To enter the message type, on the <token>request_response</token> design surface, within the <embeddedLabel>Message Types</embeddedLabel> box, select the add icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="fce8ff96-426e-468b-8afd-25eb4c847028" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to open the <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: To enter the message type, on the <token>request_response</token> design surface, within the <embeddedLabel>Message Types</embeddedLabel> box, select the add icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="fce8ff96-426e-468b-8afd-25eb4c847028" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to open the <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box lists five schemas – two ACORD request schemas (ACORDRq1.xsd and ACORDRq2.xsd), two ACORD response schemas (ACORDRs1.xsd and ACORDRs2.xsd), and one schema that is in the Northwind’s proprietary format (NorthwindSchema.xsd).
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box lists five schemas – two ACORD request schemas (ACORDRq1.xsd and ACORDRq2.xsd), two ACORD response schemas (ACORDRs1.xsd and ACORDRs2.xsd), and one schema that is in the Northwind’s proprietary format (NorthwindSchema.xsd).

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Available message types</embeddedLabel> box, select the <embeddedLabel>ACORDRq1.xsd</embeddedLabel> schema for the request message and select the RIGHT ARROW icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to add the schema to the <embeddedLabel>Request Message Type</embeddedLabel> section.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Available message types</embeddedLabel> box, select the <embeddedLabel>ACORDRq1.xsd</embeddedLabel> schema for the request message and select the RIGHT ARROW icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to add the schema to the <embeddedLabel>Request Message Type</embeddedLabel> section.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, select the <embeddedLabel>ACORDRs1.xsd</embeddedLabel> schema for the response message and select the RIGHT ARROW icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to add the schema to the <embeddedLabel>Response Message Type</embeddedLabel> section.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, select the <embeddedLabel>ACORDRs1.xsd</embeddedLabel> schema for the response message and select the RIGHT ARROW icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to add the schema to the <embeddedLabel>Response Message Type</embeddedLabel> section.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Repeat this step to add the remaining request (ACORDRq2.xsd) and response (ACORDRs2.xsd) schema and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> again.
trans-unit.target: Repeat this step to add the remaining request (ACORDRq2.xsd) and response (ACORDRs2.xsd) schema and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> again.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you do not select <embeddedLabel>NorthwindSchema.xsd</embeddedLabel> for the request or response schemas.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you do not select <embeddedLabel>NorthwindSchema.xsd</embeddedLabel> for the request or response schemas.

trans-unit.source: By default the <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box does not display the schema file names; it only displays the root node for each schema.
trans-unit.target: By default the <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel> dialog box does not display the schema file names; it only displays the root node for each schema.

trans-unit.source: In such a case, identifying the right schema can be difficult.
trans-unit.target: In such a case, identifying the right schema can be difficult.

trans-unit.source: So, to make sure that you select the right schema, move the mouse cursor over the schema to see a tooltip box.
trans-unit.target: So, to make sure that you select the right schema, move the mouse cursor over the schema to see a tooltip box.

trans-unit.source: That box displays the schema file name.
trans-unit.target: That box displays the schema file name.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Message Types</embeddedLabel> box resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Message Types</embeddedLabel> box resembles the following:

trans-unit.source: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich Stage
trans-unit.target: Configure the Pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich Stage

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, you promote properties that are used in the solution to perform further processing on the message or for routing the message to the destination.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, you promote properties that are used in the solution to perform further processing on the message or for routing the message to the destination.

trans-unit.source: As per the business scenario, there are two requirements for promoting the properties.
trans-unit.target: As per the business scenario, there are two requirements for promoting the properties.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>To extract the value in the QuoteAmount element in the request message schema</embeddedLabel>: According to the <link xlink:href="14d7f8b8-074c-485f-a2f6-c9a02cc1779a#BKMK_Scenario" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business Scenario</link>, if the value for <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> is less than $10000, the message must be routed to <embeddedLabel>RelayServiceA</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>To extract the value in the QuoteAmount element in the request message schema</embeddedLabel>: According to the <link xlink:href="14d7f8b8-074c-485f-a2f6-c9a02cc1779a#BKMK_Scenario" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business Scenario</link>, if the value for <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> is less than $10000, the message must be routed to <embeddedLabel>RelayServiceA</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, it must be routed to <embeddedLabel>RelayServiceB</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, it must be routed to <embeddedLabel>RelayServiceB</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: So, in the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> and then later, while configuring how to route messages to the right service, use the extracted property value to specify the routing condition.
trans-unit.target: So, in the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, extract the value of the <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> and then later, while configuring how to route messages to the right service, use the extracted property value to specify the routing condition.

trans-unit.source: The value for <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> element must be extracted from both the request schemas, <embeddedLabel>ACORDRq1.xsd</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>ACORDRq2.xsd</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The value for <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> element must be extracted from both the request schemas, <embeddedLabel>ACORDRq1.xsd</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>ACORDRq2.xsd</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: To extract the value in the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> element in the request schema.
trans-unit.target: To extract the value in the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> element in the request schema.

trans-unit.source: In the section, <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs2.xsd</link>, the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> property is used to enter a value to the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> node in the response schema, even though the property isn’t defined yet.
trans-unit.target: In the section, <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformRes2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map NorthwindSchema.xsd to ACORDRs2.xsd</link>, the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> property is used to enter a value to the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> node in the response schema, even though the property isn’t defined yet.

trans-unit.source: The following procedure demonstrates how to define the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> property in the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage.
trans-unit.target: The following procedure demonstrates how to define the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> property in the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage.

trans-unit.source: Extract the value for <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> element only from the <embeddedLabel>ACORDRq2.xsd</embeddedLabel> because the other request schema does not have the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> node at all.
trans-unit.target: Extract the value for <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> element only from the <embeddedLabel>ACORDRq2.xsd</embeddedLabel> because the other request schema does not have the <embeddedLabel>Comments</embeddedLabel> node at all.

trans-unit.source: To extract and promote properties in the pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich stage
trans-unit.target: To extract and promote properties in the pre-<token>transform</token> Enrich stage

trans-unit.source: In the request bridge of the <token>request_response</token> configuration, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity within the pre-<token>transform</token> <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage.
trans-unit.target: In the request bridge of the <token>request_response</token> configuration, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity within the pre-<token>transform</token> <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage.

trans-unit.source: Then, from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Then, from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel>, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel>, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Section
trans-unit.target: Section

trans-unit.source: Field Name
trans-unit.target: Field Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Source (Read From)
trans-unit.target: Source (Read From)

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>XPath</userInput> from the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>XPath</userInput> from the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Identifier
trans-unit.target: Identifier

trans-unit.source: Enter the XPath query to extract the <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmounts</embeddedLabel> element in the request schema, <embeddedLabel>ACORDRq1.xsd</embeddedLabel>:
trans-unit.target: Enter the XPath query to extract the <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmounts</embeddedLabel> element in the request schema, <embeddedLabel>ACORDRq1.xsd</embeddedLabel>:

trans-unit.source: You can get the XPath query from the schema editor.
trans-unit.target: You can get the XPath query from the schema editor.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> element in the schema editor, and in the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window look for the value of the <embeddedLabel>Instance XPath</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> element in the schema editor, and in the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window look for the value of the <embeddedLabel>Instance XPath</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: The value of the property is XPath query for the node.
trans-unit.target: The value of the property is XPath query for the node.

trans-unit.source: Message Type
trans-unit.target: Message Type

trans-unit.source: Select the schema type corresponding to ACORDRq1.xsd.
trans-unit.target: Select the schema type corresponding to ACORDRq1.xsd.

trans-unit.source: Property (Write To)
trans-unit.target: Property (Write To)

trans-unit.source: Property Name
trans-unit.target: Property Name

trans-unit.source: Set the name of the property to <userInput>QuoteAmount</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set the name of the property to <userInput>QuoteAmount</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: So, the value from the <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> element in the ACORDRq1.xsd schema is passed on to the <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: So, the value from the <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> element in the ACORDRq1.xsd schema is passed on to the <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: Data Type
trans-unit.target: Data Type

trans-unit.source: Set the data type to <userInput>long</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set the data type to <userInput>long</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel> dialog box resembles the following:

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Repeat step 2 to extract the following properties in the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage:
trans-unit.target: Repeat step 2 to extract the following properties in the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage:

trans-unit.source: Element name in the schema
trans-unit.target: Element name in the schema

trans-unit.source: Extract from schema
trans-unit.target: Extract from schema

trans-unit.source: Set property name to
trans-unit.target: Set property name to

trans-unit.source: Set data type to
trans-unit.target: Set data type to

trans-unit.source: QuoteAmount
trans-unit.target: QuoteAmount

trans-unit.source: ACORDRq2.xsd
trans-unit.target: ACORDRq2.xsd

trans-unit.source: QuoteAmount
trans-unit.target: QuoteAmount

trans-unit.source: long
trans-unit.target: long

trans-unit.source: Comments
trans-unit.target: Comments

trans-unit.source: ACORDRq2.xsd
trans-unit.target: ACORDRq2.xsd

trans-unit.source: Comments
trans-unit.target: Comments

trans-unit.source: string
trans-unit.target: string

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.

trans-unit.source: Configure the <token>transform</token> Stage in the Request Bridge
trans-unit.target: Configure the <token>transform</token> Stage in the Request Bridge

trans-unit.source: The procedure <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformReq" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map ACORDRq1.xsd and ACORDRq2.xsd to NorthwindSchema.xsd</link> demonstrates how to create two <token>transform</token>s to map the request messages to the Northwind’s request message format.
trans-unit.target: The procedure <link xlink:href="1442290a-8fca-42c6-97c4-7e3bb4e55344#BKMK_TransformReq" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To map ACORDRq1.xsd and ACORDRq2.xsd to NorthwindSchema.xsd</link> demonstrates how to create two <token>transform</token>s to map the request messages to the Northwind’s request message format.

trans-unit.source: This step demonstrates how to include the <token>transform</token>s to the request bridge of the <token>bridge</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: This step demonstrates how to include the <token>transform</token>s to the request bridge of the <token>bridge</token> configuration.

trans-unit.source: The <token>bridge</token> uses the <token>transform</token>s to process the message and then sends it to the relevant relay service.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bridge</token> uses the <token>transform</token>s to process the message and then sends it to the relevant relay service.

trans-unit.source: To enter <token>transform</token>s in a <token>bridge</token>
trans-unit.target: To enter <token>transform</token>s in a <token>bridge</token>

trans-unit.source: In the <token>request_response</token> configuration, select the <embeddedLabel>Xml Transform</embeddedLabel> activity within the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token></embeddedLabel> stage, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Maps</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>request_response</token> configuration, select the <embeddedLabel>Xml Transform</embeddedLabel> activity within the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token></embeddedLabel> stage, and from the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Maps</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Maps Selection</embeddedLabel> dialog box, by default, shows only those maps that have the source schema same as the request schema you specified earlier.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Maps Selection</embeddedLabel> dialog box, by default, shows only those maps that have the source schema same as the request schema you specified earlier.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, because the <token>bridge</token> must process and transform two request schemas, select both the <token>transform</token>s you created (one to <token>transform</token> ACORDRq1.xsd to NorthwindSchema.xsd and the other to <token>transform</token> ACORDRq2.xsd to NorthwindSchema.xsd).
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, because the <token>bridge</token> must process and transform two request schemas, select both the <token>transform</token>s you created (one to <token>transform</token> ACORDRq1.xsd to NorthwindSchema.xsd and the other to <token>transform</token> ACORDRq2.xsd to NorthwindSchema.xsd).

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Maps Selection</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Maps Selection</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The maps you added are listed under the <embeddedLabel>Selected Maps</embeddedLabel> box on the <token>bridge</token> designer surface.
trans-unit.target: The maps you added are listed under the <embeddedLabel>Selected Maps</embeddedLabel> box on the <token>bridge</token> designer surface.

trans-unit.source: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: Save the <token>bridge</token> configuration.
